message: Well, I always said reality TV was stupid, but this is overrated.

The Rouskies and Chinese are both farting in our face and laugh ing we are a global joke. The line in the sand was a pathetic nuance to the world. We may not recover our dignity for decades.

Jake that isn't true. They do not make public school uniform wearers wear a sweater at all times. They have short sleeve shirts they can wear. And I never had AC when I was kid at home or school and I always had 30+ kids in my classes. We all made it and turned out just fine. Sure it was hot at times and sure it sucked, but we survived and we even managed to still complete all our work in school and chores at home. Also, temperatures now are no worse than they were then. That is just made up crap people say. While I do think that they should work on getting AC in schools simply just to make it more comfortable and so schools don't have to close when it gets to hot, I also think we are making this generation into a bunch of sissy cry babies who can't handle anything and thinks the whole world should change and revolve around them and what they want. Then when they don't get their way they throw temper tantrums and cause a ruckus. Well it's not a good thing because the real world doesn't work like that. In the real world you have to be tough and have thick skin, be able to endure situations where you may not be the most comfortable and still have to function and do your job, etc.. These kids need to learn this somehow and constantly being pampered isn't teaching them anything.

Is Hillary a Shill for Monsanto? How is Hillary personally involved in supporting big agriculture? The Clinton Global Initiative (CGI), which gathers leaders to solve the world's problems, promotes Monsanto, the maker of RoundUpÂ and RoundUp ReadyÂ seeds. Hugh Grant, Monsanto's Chairman and CEO spoke at the Clinton Global Initiative conference in September, 2014. Ms. Clinton's top campaign advisor, Jerry Crawford, was a lobbyist for Monsanto for years and is now the political pro for her Super PAC, """"Ready for Hillary."""" Clinton spoke in favor of the government's Feed the Future (FtF) program, a USAID funded, corporate-partnered program that brings RoundUp ReadyÂ technology to the most vulnerable populations of the world. Monsanto and Dow Chemical support Hillary and Bill's 'Clinton Foundation' with generous donations.
